* This class represents an Event, which is a Task with a timing.
* Gives the type of the task.
* This class takes in a saved file and loads whatever tasks were saved in it.
* Saved file should be structured in this manner:
* - In each line, start with a T(odo), D(eadline), E(vent)
* - Space out each detail with a "|'
* - If empty line, assume end of file
Deadline eventDeadline = new Deadline(taskName, LocalDateTime.parse(deadline, formatter));
Event eventEvent = new Event(taskName, LocalDateTime.parse(time, formatter));
* This class represents a task to be done in the TaskList.
* Gives the type of the Task (i.e Event, ToDo, Deadline). To be overriden.
* Gives the description of the task.
* Shows the state of the task.
* Gives a save-file friendly version of the task. To be overriden in child classes.
* @param print determines if the task being marked as done should be printed.
System.out.println("     Nice! I've marked this task as done:");
* This class represents a TaskList, which is the list of tasks that Duke refers to to carry out commands provided
* Adds an item to the TaskList.
* This method is for Level-3, and is not longer used w.e.f Level-4
* @param input the item to be added to the TaskList
* Adds an Event to the TaskList.
* @param event event to be added to the TaskList
public void add(Event event, boolean print) {
System.out.println("     Got it. I've added this task:");
System.out.printf("     Now you have %d tasks in the list.%n", list.size());
* Adds a deadline to the TaskList.
* @param deadline deadline to be added to the TaskList
public void add(Deadline deadline, boolean print) {

System.out.printf("     Now you have %d tasks in the list.%n", list.size());
* Adds a toDo to the TaskList.

* Finishes a task at a given index.
* @param index index from 1 (i.e lowest index is 1, so subtract 1 to get real index)
* Lists out the current items in the TaskList.
System.out.println("     You have no tasks in your list!");
System.out.println("     Try adding some tasks with todo, event or deadline");
System.out.println("     Here are the tasks in your list:");
* This method is to be used when quitting and saving the file.
* @return the resulting string containing save-friendly information
* Deletes a task at a certain index
* @param index index from 1 (i.e lowest index is 1, so subtract 1 to get real index)
System.out.println("     Noted. I've removed this task:");
System.out.printf("     Now you have %d tasks in the list.%n", list.size());
* Represents a ToDo, which is the simplest of Tasks.
